channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2691] 20 Things Worth Knowing About Beer (INFOGRAPHIC)
item.description: Apparently if you brewed a bad batch of beer in ancient babylon, your punishment was to be drowned in it.

item.title: [+2256] The Dolphin Experience (Pic)
[+1867] Mario's True Origin
[+1722] Not Having to Wake Up After a Wet Dream... Priceless
[+1515] An Open Letter to President Obama from Michael Moore
item.description: "If you go to West Point tomorrow night (Tuesday, 8pm) and announce that you are increasing, rather than withdrawing, the troops in Afghanistan, you are the new war president. Pure and simple. And with that you will do the worst possible thing you could do -- destroy the hopes and dreams so many millions have placed in you."

item.title: [+1503] The irony here we come [PIC]
[+1227] Bathroom Vending - What to put between Condoms and Advil
[+1066] 5 Big Changes to Watch in Facebook's Upcoming Redesign
item.description: Just over a month ago, Facebook rolled out a new homepage redesign. Now it looks like the social network isn't completely satisfied with the results, as it's now testing yet another homepage redesign.

item.title: [+952] Rumsfeld decision let Bin Laden escape: Senate report
item.description: Osama bin Laden was "within the grasp" of US forces in late 2001 but escaped because then-defense secretary Donald Rumsfeld rejected calls for reinforcements, a hard-hitting US Senate report says.

item.title: [+891] Random captcha! WTF!
item.description: Captcha is supposed to generate random letters... But is it really random? Just got this one on Snub!

item.title: [+785] New 'Iron Man 2' Poster. First-Look At War Machine (pic)
[+772] Man Forced to Choose Between Saving Drowning Wife or Son
item.description: After his wife's car plunged into a river, Stacy Horton had an agonizing decision to make: rescue her or their teenage son. His wife Vanessa had escaped from the car but was crying for help as she struggled to keep her head above water, while their son Silva, 13, was still trapped inside...With time to save only one, Mr Horton

item.title: [+771] Tiger Woods' Problem And Why Not To Talk To Police
item.description: Your Fifth Amendment Right To Remain Silent Exists For A Reason. Use It.

item.title: [+657] Artificial (COMIC)
item.description: Is it really artificial if it's natural for us to do it?

item.title: [+620] Homeowners have to fight HOAs to install solar panels
item.description: Battles between homeowners groups and property owners are cropping up across CA as installation of solar systems becomes more affordable and utility costs rise. Homeowners boards insist they are protecting property values, but residents say their right to invest in alternative energy trumps sensibilities of neighbors who don't like how they look

item.title: [+614] There’s No Such Thing as a ‘Simple’ Organism
item.description: What may be the most thorough study ever of a single organism has produced a beta code for life’s essential subroutines, and shown that even the simplest creatures are more complex than scientists suspected.

item.title: [+568] Marijuana Sales Boost Northern California County
item.description: It's boom times for the marijuana trade in Northern California. Rural Humboldt County's economy depends on both the legal and illegal sales of pot, as growers to trimmers to entrepreneurs aim to land quick cash. But some citizens, and the mayor of Arcata, are trying to "rope back in" the business.

item.title: [+563] Birth control pill for men?
item.description: Scientists have found how and where androgenic hormones work in the testis to control normal sperm production and male fertility. This opens a promising avenue for the development of "the pill" for men. The discovery also offers hope to those who cannot have children because of low sperm counts....

item.title: [+548] Calls wrong number: "Please Send Money for Food"- money sent
item.description: Lucy Crutchfield leaves message telling her daughter she will miss a mortgage payment, to send her money for food, on wrong number. Owner (Virginia Saenz) of wrong number calls back, pays for groceries so woman can keep her house.

item.title: [+546] Vampax: 'He'll Never Guess it's your Bleeding Vagina'
item.description: Don't let that time of the month interfere with your vampire romance.
